text: American actress Lisa Kudrow has been honored with numerous accolades over her career. For her role in the sitcom Friends, she received six nominations at the Primetime Emmy Awards, winning in 1998 for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series. Kudrow has also received twelve nominations and two wins at the Screen Actors Guild Awards, as well as one win and eight nominations at the American Comedy Awards. ==Major associations== ===Primetime Emmy Awards=== The Primetime Emmy Award is an American award bestowed by the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences (ATAS) in recognition of excellence in American primetime television programming. Kudrow has received one award from eleven nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1995 | rowspan="6"|Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series | rowspan="6"| Friends | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 1997 | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 1998 | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 1999 | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2000 | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2001 | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2006 | Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series | The Comeback | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2012 | Outstanding Reality Program | Who Do You Think You Are? | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Outstanding Short-Format Live-Action Entertainment Program | Web Therapy | |- | align="center"| 2014 | Outstanding Structured Reality Program | Who Do You Think You Are? | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2015 | Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series | The Comeback | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2017 | Outstanding Structured Reality Program | Who Do You Think You Are? | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2018 | Outstanding Structured Reality Program | Who Do You Think You Are? | | align="center"| |- | align="centre"| 2019 | Outstanding Structured Reality Program | Who Do You Think You Are? | |} ===Golden Globe Awards=== The Golden Globe Awards are accolades bestowed by the 93 members of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association beginning in January 1944, recognizing excellence in film and television, both domestic and foreign. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1996 | Best Supporting Actress – Series, Miniseries or Television Film | Friends | | align="center"| |} ===Screen Actors Guild Awards=== The Screen Actors Guild Awards are accolades given by the Screen Actors Guild‐American Federation of Television and Radio Artists to recognize outstanding performances in film and prime time television. Kudrow has received two awards from twelve nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1994 | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | Mad About You | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 1995 | Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series | rowspan="11"| Friends | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 1998 | Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 1999 | Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | align="center"| 2000 | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2001 | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2002 | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2003 | Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |} ==Other awards== ===American Comedy Awards=== The American Comedy Awards are a group of awards presented annually in the United States recognizing performances and performers in the field of comedy, with an emphasis on television comedy and comedy films. Kudrow has received one award from eight nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1996 | Funniest Supporting Female Performer in a TV Series | Friends | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 1999 | Funniest Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture | The Opposite of Sex | | rowspan="3" align="center"| |- | Funniest Supporting Female Performer in a TV Series | Friends | |- | Funniest Female Guest Appearance in a TV Series | Mad About You | |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 2000 | Funniest Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture | Analyze This | | rowspan="3" align="center"| |- | Funniest Supporting Female Performer in a TV Series | Friends | |- | Funniest Female Performer in a TV Special – Network, Cable or Syndication | 1999 MTV Movie Awards | |- | align="center"| 2001 | Funniest Supporting Female Performer in a TV Series | Friends | | align="center"| |} ===Banff Rockie Awards=== The Banff World Media Festival is an international media event held in the Canadian Rockies at the Fairmont Banff Springs Hotel in Banff, Alberta, Canada. The festival is dedicated to world television and digital content and its creation and development. The festival features an international program competition, the Banff Rockie Awards, which are broadcast on CBC. Kudrow has received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2011 | Award of Excellence in Digital Media | Web Therapy | | align="center"| |} ===Blockbuster Entertainment Awards=== The Blockbuster Entertainment Awards were a film awards ceremony, founded by Blockbuster Inc., that ran from 1995 until 2001. Kudrow received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2000 | Favorite Supporting Actress – Comedy | Analyze This | | align="center"| |} ===Chicago Film Critics Association Awards=== The Chicago Film Critics Association is an association of professional film critics, who work in print, broadcast and online media, based in Chicago, Illinois, United States. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Supporting Actress | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |} ===Chlotrudis Awards=== The Chlotrudis Awards are American film awards given since 1995 by the Chlotrudis Society for Independent Film. They are considered among the most important awards of international independent cinema. Kudrow has received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1999 | Best Supporting Actress | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |} ===Critics' Choice Television Awards=== The Critics' Choice Television Awards are accolades that are presented annually by the Broadcast Television Journalists Association. Kudrow has received two nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2015 | Best Actress in a Comedy Series | The Comeback | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2016 | Best Guest Performer in a Comedy Series | Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt | | align="center"| |} ===Dorian Awards=== The Dorian Awards are an annual endeavor organized by GALECA: The Society of LGBTQ Entertainment Critics (founded in 2009 as the Gay and Lesbian Entertainment Critics Association). Kudrow has received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2014 | TV Performance of the Year – Actress | The Comeback | | align="center"| |} ===Gold Derby Awards=== The Gold Derby Awards are awards given by the website Goldderby.com (Gold Derby) for television and film. Kudrow has received six nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2004 | Best Comedy Actress | Friends | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2006 | Best Comedy Actress | The Comeback | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2010 | Best Comedy Guest Actress | Cougar Town | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2015 | Best Comedy Actress | The Comeback | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Best Comedy Episode of the Year | "Valerie Gets What She Really Wants" | |- | align="center"| 2016 | Best Comedy Guest Actress | Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt | | align="center"| |} ===Golden Raspberry Awards=== The Golden Raspberry Awards (also known as the Razzie Awards) is a mock award in recognition of the worst in film. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1997 | Worst New Star | Mother | | align="center"| |} ===Gracie Awards=== The Gracie Awards are awards presented by the Alliance for Women in Media Foundation in America, to celebrate and honor programming created for women, by women, and about women, as well as individuals who have made exemplary contributions in electronic media and affiliates. Kudrow has received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2006 | Outstanding Female Lead – Comedy Series | The Comeback | | align="center"| |} ===Independent Spirit Awards=== The Independent Spirit Awards, founded in 1984, are awards dedicated to independent filmmakers. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Supporting Female | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |} ===MTV Movie and TV Awards=== The MTV Movie & TV Awards (formerly known as the MTV Movie Awards) is a film and television awards show presented annually on MTV. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Dance Sequence | Romy and Michele's High School Reunion | | align="center"| |} ===National Society of Film Critics Awards=== The National Society of Film Critics is an American film critic organization. The organization is known for its highbrow tastes, and its annual awards are one of the most prestigious film critics awards in the United States. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Supporting Actress | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |} ===New York Film Critics Circle Awards=== The New York Film Critics Circle is an American film critic organization founded in 1935. Its membership includes over 30 film critics from New York-based daily and weekly newspapers, magazines, online publications. Kudrow has received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Supporting Actress | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |} ===Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards=== The Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards is an American 90-minute-long annual awards show that airs on Nickelodeon. Usually held on a Saturday day, morning, or night in late March or early April, the show that honors the year's biggest television, movie, and music acts as voted by Nickelodeon viewers. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2000 | Favorite TV Friends | Friends | | align="center"| |} ===Online Film and Television Association Awards=== The Online Film & Television Association are a group of individuals centered in the United States whose primary interest is in the annual presentation of awards recognizing not only the best of the year, but also the past with their hall of fame. Kudrow has received one award from nineteen nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | rowspan="5" align="center"| 1997 | Best Supporting Actress in a Series | rowspan="4"| Friends | | rowspan="5" align="center"| |- | Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series | |- | Best Ensemble in a Series | |- | Best Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | Best Guest Actress in a Comedy Series | Mad About You | |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 1998 | Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series | rowspan="3"| Friends | | rowspan="3" align="center"| |- | Best Ensemble in a Series | |- | Best Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 1999 | Best Supporting Actress | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |- | Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series | rowspan="6"| Friends | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Best Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2000 | Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Best Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2001 | Best Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Best Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 2015 | Best Actress in a Comedy Series | rowspan="3"| The Comeback | | rowspan="3" align="center"| |- | Best Ensemble in a Comedy Series | |- | Best Writing in a Comedy Series | |- | align="center"| 2016 | Best Guest Actress in a Comedy Series | Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt | | align="center"| |} ===Online Film Critics Society Awards=== The Online Film Critics Society is an international professional association of online film journalists, historians and scholars who publish their work on the World Wide Web. Kudrow has received one nomination. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Supporting Actress | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |} ===People Magazine Awards=== The People Magazine Awards was a one-off American awards ceremony that aired on December 18, 2014. Kudrow received one award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2014 | TV Performance of the Year – Actress | The Comeback | | align="center"| |} ===Satellite Awards=== The Satellite Awards are annual awards given by the International Press Academy that are commonly noted in entertainment industry journals and blogs. Kudrow has received one award from five nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1998 | Best Actress – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy | Romy and Michele's High School Reunion | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2001 | Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy | rowspan="2"| Friends | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2002 | Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2006 | Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy | The Comeback | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2008 | Best Actress – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy | Kabluey | | align="center"| |} ===Teen Choice Awards=== The Teen Choice Awards is an annual awards show that airs on the Fox television network. The awards honor the year's biggest achievements in music, film, sports, television, fashion, and more, voted by viewers aged 13 to 19. Kudrow has received one award from three nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1999 | Choice Movie: Hissy Fit | The Opposite of Sex | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2000 | Choice Movie: Hissy Fit | Hanging Up | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2002 | Choice TV Actress: Comedy | Friends | | align="center"| |} ===The Stinkers Bad Movie Awards=== The Stinkers Bad Movie Awards (formerly known as the Hastings Bad Cinema Society) was a Los Angeles-based group of film buffs and movie critics devoted to honoring the worst films of the year. Kudrow received four nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2000 | Worst On-Screen Group | Hanging Up | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 2003 | Worst Actress | rowspan="2"| Marci X | | rowspan="3" align="center"| |- | Worst On-Screen Couple | |- | Worst Song | "Power in My Purse" | |} ===Streamy Awards=== The Streamy Awards, often referred to as the Streamys, are presented annually by Dick Clark Productions and Tubefilter to recognize and honor excellence in online video, including directing, acting, producing and writing. Kudrow has received two nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 2009 | Best Female Actor in a Comedy Web Series | rowspan="2"| Web Therapy | | align="center"| |- | align="center"| 2010 | Best Female Actor in a Comedy Web Series | | align="center"| |} ===TV Guide Awards=== The TV Guide Award was an annual award created by the editors of TV Guide magazine, as a readers poll to honor outstanding programs and performers in the American television industry. The awards were presented until 1964. The TV Guide Award was revived 1999–2001. Kudrow received one award from two nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2000 | Favorite Actress in a Comedy Series | rowspan="2"| Friends | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Editor's Choice | |} ===Viewers for Quality Television Awards=== Viewers for Quality Television was an American nonprofit organization founded in 1984 to advocate network television series that members of the organization voted to be of the "highest quality". Kudrow received one nomination for their Q Award. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | align="center"| 1996 | Best Supporting Actress in a Quality Comedy Series | Friends | | align="center"| |} ===Webby Awards=== A Webby Award is an award for excellence on the Internet presented annually by The International Academy of Digital Arts and Sciences, a judging body composed of over two thousands industry experts and technology innovators. Kudrow has received four awards from seven nominations. {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! width="7%"| Year ! width="48%"| Category ! width="30%"| Nominated work ! width="10%"| Result ! width="5%"| Ref |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2009 | Outstanding Comedic Performance | rowspan="7"| Web Therapy | | align="center"| |- | Best Writing | | align="center"| |- | rowspan="3" align="center"| 2010 | Best Individual Performance | | rowspan="3" align="center"| |- | Best Comedy: Long Form or Series | |- | Best Writing | |- | rowspan="2" align="center"| 2011 | Best Individual Performance | | rowspan="2" align="center"| |- | Best Comedy: Long Form or Series | |} ==References== ==External links== * * Kudrow, Lisa
title: List of awards and nominations received by Lisa Kudrow
